1.title: Build Independence (101)
1.plot: When children leave for short trips like summer camp, parents often get a glimpse into the future-the life they might lead when their children are grown and gone from home. How can they make the best use of these few days to support their own-and their child's-budding independence?

2.title: Come Together (102)
2.plot: The joys of bringing the family together can also be stressors. Laura explores this topic from the Empty Nester's viewpoint, emphasizing personal health and wellness-as well as the health of the family.

3.title: Find Balance (103)
3.plot: The "Sandwich Generation" often finds that just as the children are leaving the house, aging parents are moving in. We'll focus on supporting the people who are in the middle, caring for both children and parents.

4.title: Expand Minds (104)
4.plot: When the kids go to school, parents find more time for themselves. And they learn to support their growing children in new ways. Laura Lewis is on hand, teaching parents how to handle this transition healthily.

5.title: Adventure (105)
5.plot: This is the big step-packing the kids off for their first foray into their lives as adults, and your life without children at home. Laura Lewis shows you how to embrace your freedom while still parenting from a distance.

6.title: Holiday Spirit (106)
6.plot: There's no place like home for the holidays, but the adjustment of empty nesters to have a house full of family can be overwhelming. Laura Lewis comes to the rescue in how to create a joyful winter break.

7.title: Let Go (107)
7.plot: Losing someone is not easy. For an empty nester to cope with losing a spouse or parent, requires building a solid support network. We'll learn some strategies for the grieving process to be a healthy one.

8.title: Refresh (108)
8.plot: Fun in the sun - or is it? Whether an empty nester has to learn to carpool again with their college age child, or managing summer activities of a 1st grader, planning ahead for summer can be a breeze.

9.title: Heritage (109)
9.plot: In a tribute to grandparents, we focus on wonderful things an empty nester can do to create meaningful memories with the grand-kids.

10.title: Take Flight (110)
10.plot: Stepping outside your comfort zone. Surprise yourself learning how to create new and exciting lives that didn't leave them feeling like their nests were empty. Laura Lewis will share some of their stories of triumph.

11.title: Metamorphosis (111)
11.plot: "Mom - don't kiss me in front of my friends anymore!" Maneuvering the "tween" years is nothing short of an art form - but you can learn to cope the season of no longer being interesting to your child with grace and aplomb. And you can use this time to go through your own personal metamorphosis.

12.title: Discover (112)
12.plot: Empty nesters learn a whole new level of coping. When their teen's need for independence begin to emerge, they also learn they have new time to focus on themselves. Laura Lewis, an expert mom who has mastered the teen years, will help show how to be a loving presence while letting go.

13.title: Whimsical Diversions (113)
13.plot: With extra time on their hands, empty nesters have an opportunity to explore hobbies they might have put off in earlier years. We will learn about couples and individuals who made pursued their hobbies enriching their lives in whole new ways.

14.title: Faithful Friends (114)
14.plot: Research has shown that animals provide tremendous therapeutic and de-stressing benefits to us mere humans. We will learn about animal companions who are simply loveable pets, as well as people who use these precious critters to help others, whether it be a hospital, prisons or CCI trainers.

15.title: Solitude (115)
15.plot: Time alone to rejuvenate is important whether someone is married or single. Laura Lewis will take a look at ways to enjoy your time alone.

16.title: Family Time (116)
16.plot: A look at what some empty nesters have done to create a meaningful family vacation to reconnect everyone together.

17.title: Back to Nature (117)
17.plot: Whether it be hiking, or going on a nature tour, empty nesters can enjoy the serenity of Mother Earth with these wonderful suggestions from host Laura Lewis.

18.title: Feather the Nest (118)
18.plot: Extreme Home Makeover - Empty Nester style. Laura Lewis will give us suggestions on what do with the empty bedroom after the college-bound child moves out.

19.title: Career Connections (119)
19.plot: Laura Lewis will help Empty Nesters revamp and take charge of their careers, as well as show stay-at-home moms how to launch into the career world for the first time.

20.title: Community (120)
20.plot: Empty Nesters have the vast experience in succeeding at the art of raising a family that can help others in the community. Laura Lewis will look at mentors, as well as others who have used their time to effectively reach out to the community (such as the welcoming committee for the troops).

21.title: Make the Move (121)
21.plot: With fewer members living at home, many empty nesters choose to change their abode - some downsize, while others move to places they've never dreamed of, but always wanted to.

22.title: Mindful Living (122)
22.plot: It isn't easy being green...how green are you? Laura Lewis gives viewers helpful tips on honoring their health and the health of the planet, and what some empty nesters are doing to keep the earth clean.

23.title: Take Risks (123)
23.plot: Life is full of changes for our children as well as for us. Laura Lewis shows us that this is the perfect opportunity to break through barriers and conquer what holds us back.

24.title: Liberate (124)
24.plot: Empty nesters will learn how to give their lives a financial makeover and how to get - and stay -- out of debt.

25.title: Give Back (125)
25.plot: Whether it be helping at a hospital, becoming a big brother, or feeding the homeless, Laura Lewis will introduce us to some inspiring individuals who have made a huge difference in their community.

26.title: Renew (126)
26.plot: Weekend getaways for couples are available all over the country. We'll celebrate marriage and learn about some wonderful ways that couples have thrived through their nester days.
